paper_abstract: Magnetohydrodynamical instabilities such as Alfven Eigenmodes and Neoclassical tearing modes redistribute energetic particles and, thus, potentially endanger the confinement of, e.g., fusion born alphas in Tokamaks. The orbit-following studies so far have been restricted either to time-independent approximation of the rotating modes, or to an axisymmetric magnetic field, which is an assumption severely compromised in ITER. In this paper we extend the previous work to accommodate time. dependent modes in non-axisymmetric magnetic fields. (C) 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Alfven Eigenmodes and Neoclassical tearing modes for orbit-following implementations
